items.content_html:
Fixes #9170

Code inspection shows that AV1 is only disabled on a small subset OS/hardware. This clarifies and links to bug for remaining part. Many thanks to @jwatt
items.title: FF supports AV1 but not on android and windows on ARM

items.content_html:
Part of #9218.

This PR cleans out most class attributes from the CSS docs, and some other attributes too.

I left the uses of lang="fr" and lang="ja" in the list of dates in https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/HTML/Introduction_to_HTML/Advanced_text_formatting#marking_up_times_and_dates but perhaps I should have removed them too? (also I think perhaps the second of those ought to be lang="zh-CN"?).
items.title: [Markdown] [Learn] Clean up classes

items.content_html:
Part of #9218.

This PR removes most inline styles from the Learn docs.

It leaves them alone in:

  • the table at https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/Styling_text/Fundamentals#default_fonts
  • the tables at https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Forms/Property_compatibility_table_for_form_controls#compatibility_tables
  • the table at https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/HTML/Cheatsheet#inline_elements

I don't love the use of inline styles in these tables, but they will not be converted to Markdown anyway, so removing them is a fair bit of work and doesn't get the conversion any further.
items.title: [Markdown] [Learn] Remove (most) inline styles

items.content_html:
Part of #9218.

This PR fixes up <dl> elements in the Learn area so they will be converted properly. In a few places I thought it would be better to use alternatives.
items.title: [Markdown] [Learn] Fix dl elements

items.content_html:
This is the result of running:

npx prettier --write ./files/en-us/web/javascript

...which has the effect of prettifying the JS code blocks in the JS documentation.

Just an experiment to see if we might want to do this.
items.title: Prettify code blocks in JavaScript docs

items.content_html:
Summary

Tidying up release notes for Firefox 93 release - bumping versions and adding 95 file

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: FF93 release notes

items.content_html:
HTMLScriptElement.supports() support is added in FF94 by https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1729239.

This doc adds method docs.

The main purpose of this is future proofing. Right now the spec is hard coded to for this method to return true for classic or module scripts, and false for everything else. There are also other ways to work out whether those are supported. However there are other upcoming types that are very hard to work out using other methods - when they come along this will need to be updated.

I mention this because normally we don't refer to future work in the description. This therefore looks a bit pointless. Just so you know.

Other docs work (e.g. BCD) tracked in #9365

@Rumyra As an aside, is there a right place to create interactive examples for things like this, or are web APIs like this primarily done as live examples? I did it that way.
items.title: HTMLScriptElement.supports() method docs

items.content_html:
should I?

items.content_html:
Enterkeyhint is enabled by default on FF94: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1648332

This adds a release note. Other docs work can be tracked in #9367
items.title: FF94 Relelease note: enterkeyhint supported

items.content_html: self.structuredClone() supported in FF94. Other work for this can be tracked in #9370

items.content_html:
Summary

Not sure how to phrase it, but the page should say that execCommand is only partially deprecated. The command insertText was lately implemented in FF89 and is available in all other browsers (except IE).

Oh, I made a typo: programtially -> programmatically. But cannot edit the file again (at least in Github GUI, weird...)

As a side note: This new GUI for the MDN wiki is very weird. I'm an editor of Wikipedia from 16 years and of MDN probably 10 years... And this is confusing. No preview even and a lot of effort for fixing a typo or something.

Motivation

See: w3c/editing#160 (comment)

Supporting details

Related issues

Should probably also mention this in Compat.

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error

items.content_html:
Bumps boxen from 5.0.1 to 6.0.0.

Release notes

Sourced from boxen's releases.

v6.0.0

Breaking

  • Require Node.js 12.20 (#67) 8747277
  • This package is now pure ESM. Please read this.

sindresorhus/boxen@v5.1.2...v6.0.0

v5.1.2

  • Don't trim whitespace in input text needlessly (#63) 760e247

sindresorhus/boxen@v5.1.1...v5.1.2

v5.1.1

  • Fix a regression (#61) 82291e8

sindresorhus/boxen@v5.1.0...v5.1.1

v5.1.0

  • Add title and titleAlignment options (#59) c50dad6

sindresorhus/boxen@v5.0.1...v5.1.0

Commits
  • 79651fe 6.0.0
  • 3c0a9b6 Meta tweaks
  • 8747277 Move to ESM (#67)
  • a5cfc85 Fix typo (#66)
  • 84d24fe Fix invalid escape in test string (#65)
  • badc4bc Welcome @â€‹Caesarovich as a maintainer
  • 724f59c Rework tests to use snapshots (#64)
  • f227da7 5.1.2
  • 760e247 Don't trim whitespace in input text needlessly (#63)
  • dff6c30 5.1.1
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting @dependabot rebase.

Dependabot commands and options

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:

  • @dependabot rebase will rebase this PR
  • @dependabot recreate will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
  • @dependabot merge will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot squash and merge will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot cancel merge will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
  • @dependabot reopen will reopen this PR if it is closed
  • @dependabot close will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
  • @dependabot ignore this major version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this minor version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this dependency will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

items.content_html:
Changes for Checkbox_radio_button example to conform to the rule stated at the top of the page (i.e. elements, when all radio buttons with the same name value in the form are unchecked) that is we need more than one radio button in order to see the effect. Moreover, minor changes have been made.

Note: regarding the Checkbox_radio_button example I'm not sure whether changes I've made are enough or should it also be changed in some external example that is used by {{EmbedLiveSample('Checkbox_radio_button', 'auto', 50)}}. Any help would be much appreciated.
items.title: Change Checkbox_radio_button example
